data.title: Powered Business Journey with Accenture on AWS
data.meta_description: AWS Lake Formation is an AWS serverless service that has cross-account capabilities and can simplify securing access to data across multiple accounts through a centralized approach, providing fine-grained role-based or tag-based access control to Athena tables.
data.text:
Data foundation

Organizations building a multi-account architecture require a scalable and unified access enforcement mechanism to support ML workloads across multiple accounts.

AWS Lake Formation is an AWS serverless service that has cross-account capabilities and can simplify securing access to data across multiple accounts through a centralized approach, providing fine-grained role-based or tag-based access control to Athena tables.

In this architecture pattern, the data catalog is centralized in one AWS account, and Lake Formation acts as a central data governance capability. Lake Formation allows cross-account access to the Data Catalog metadata, and underlying data to users of the ML workload accounts, as shown in the following diagram.

Consider the following questions when designing your centralized data catalog:

Introducing Intelligence Data Foundation (IDF) âoneâ catalog

IDF is an Accenture framework that accelerates the build and deployment of governed enterprise data and ML products on AWS.

IDF includes a metadata engine that ensures data are labeled, tagged, classified, and profiled as they are ingested, or curated into the data lake or the SageMaker Feature Store.

IDF augments the technical metadata captured by AWS Glue Data Catalog with business and operational metadata and builds a centralized âoneâ catalog backed by Amazon OpenSearch Service. IDF uses Amazon ML services and custom scripts to capture the additional metadata.

IDF facilitates data discovery and provisioning of ML ready datasets for data science teams, integrating closely with the multi-account architecture and lake formation services to enable cross-account fine-grained access controls to the data lake.

The goal of the IDF one catalog framework is to enable:
